value.name: Sacramento Bee sues city seeking release of records in Darell Richards police killing
value.description: The city is withholding the documents despite a law the California Legislature passed in 2018 that requires their release, The Bee alleges.

video.name: Sacramento Bee sues city seeking release of records in Darell Richards police killing

value.name: The Bee is suing Sacramento for police records. Why is the city breaking transparency laws?
value.description: Sacramento fancies itself as a leader on police reforms, but withholding records after police officers fatally shot a Black teenager sends a far different message, writes The Sacramento Bee Editorial

value.name: Kyra Sedgwick once ruined a film screening at Tom Cruise's house after accidentally pushing a panic button
value.description: And he goes, 'That's the panic button,'" Sedgwick said. The celebrity gettogether was then interrupted when police responded to the accidental panic button push. Sedgwick said, to her recollection, more than five police cars arrived at Cruise's house.
